title: THE TRACE
logline: A confused young woman drifts through a high school where periodic pulses destabilize student groups until the only students who see her reveal a hidden signal that leads to urgent diagnosis.
theme: Some forces do not heal, they reveal what was hiding.

lines.text: A young woman bursts from a chlorinated school pool and steadies her breath under harsh lights.
Nearby synchronized swimmers hold exact symmetry and ignore her at the edge of formation.
From the top. Together.
lines.speaker: Coach

lines.text: A pulse rolls across the water and the team snaps back into alignment after a brief wobble.
On an overhead catwalk two grey suited technicians mark notes while she loses them in glare.
Recovery.
lines.speaker: Tech 1

lines.text: Baseline holds.
lines.speaker: Tech 2

lines.text: She enters a busy passage lined with lockers and trophy glass as students flow past.
Another pulse jolts several students who recover instantly and resume the same rhythm.
Inside a gym frame cheerleaders hold a pyramid and absorb the pulse with tiny adjustments.
Hold. Smile.
lines.speaker: Cheer Captain

lines.text: She leans in to speak but their eyes slide past and the crowd swallows her again.
At a glass-walled studio dancers rehearse clean lines while her reflection echoes their movement.
Keep moving.
lines.speaker: Ballerina

lines.text: A pulse shakes the dancers for a beat and perfect posture returns without assistance.
At the far side a technician tracks her path and ignores the performers.
No binding. Keep her moving.
lines.speaker: Tech 2

lines.text: She reaches an older practice room where students with braces and crutches finally meet her gaze.
A hard pulse drops the group in a chaotic collapse with crutches skidding across the floor.
She catches one student by the forearm and a bright metallic tint streaks across both hands.
Don't, you marked me.
lines.speaker: Injury Kid

lines.text: She tries to lift another student and the tint spreads in louder streaks across fabric and skin.
Stop touching us! Get it off!
lines.speaker: Injury Kid

lines.text: Panic turns to anger as students scrub the stains and knock chairs aside.
Outside the room a technician triggers a control box and red emergency light floods the scene.
Flag. High signal.
lines.speaker: Tech 1

lines.text: Both technicians seize her elbows and drag her away while the group rages under red light.
We got what we needed.
lines.speaker: Tech 2

lines.text: A radiology suite replaces the chaos as a patient opens their eyes to calm routine.
The contrast highlighted a lesion. We found it early. Next step is treatment.
lines.speaker: Radiologist
